pageContext.claim: “You know, I was dealt a lot of bad hands. I was given North Korea where, frankly, we were very close to going to war. You could have lost 30 million people, 50 million people. Seoul is 30 miles off the border. They have what they call cannons, like howitzers. They have cannons, thousands of them, pointed.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump exaggerates the North Korean nuclear threat during Barack Obama's administration and exaggerates the number of potential casualties. According to the Congressional Research Service, “an escalation of a military conflict on the peninsula could affect upwards of 25 million people on either side of the border.”
